FRS_Method: GPS CODE (PSEUDO RANGE) STANDARD POSITION (SA OFF)

_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: storage coolers, freezers and compressor rooms
_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: man way inspection in compressor room #1
_prev_prog_3.Description:
King & Prince Seafood is in compliance with OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.119, Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals. The following engineering and administrative controls are in place to eliminate or reduce the possibility of an accidental release of ammonia from this facility.

* Electronic ammonia detection in storage freezers and processing coolers. Systems will automatically activate a local audible alarm to alert personnel of a possible leak.

* Compressors are configured with critical safety devices which will shutdown compressor operation if abnormal condition is sensed.

* Recirculation vessels are equipped with high level detection switches that will shutdown the associated compressor if a high level is sensed.

* Safety relief valves are installed on all pressure vessels, most condensers and compressor oil separators to eliminate the possibility of an over-pressurization condition in those pieces of equipment.

* Computerized maintenance management system is in place to ensure proper maintenance is completed on a timely manner with manufacturing recommendation. This information is stored in the system and can be reviewed by all shifts. This system allows King & Prince Seafood to maintain the refrigeration systems in optimum operational and mechanical condition.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
KING & PRINCE SEAFOOD CORPORATION
RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


1.General accidental release and prevention policy of King & Prince Seafood Corporation.

King & Prince Seafood Corporation is a frozen seafood processing facility that utilizes anhydrous ammonia as a refrigerant.  Anhydrous ammonia is considered hazardous by the Environmental Protection Agency.  The same properties that make ammonia a valuable refrigerant also makes it necessary to observe certain safety precautions during its use to prevent exposure to our workers, the surrounding community and the environment.
It is our policy at King & Prince to implement the requirements of the Risk Management Program by managing and operating this facility in full compliance with all applicable federal and state regulations that we are governed by.  The objective is to minimize the risk of an accidental release of hazardous materials.  Safety depends directly on our proper handing of ammonia.  Our plant personnel have been trained on the equipment operating procedures and the various safety devices that are incorporated in our facility to prevent the possibility of accidental releases.

2.Stationary source and regulated substance handled.

King & Prince Seafood Corporation, 1 King & Prince Boulevard, Brunswick, Georgia operates a refrigeration system utilizing anhydrous ammonia as the primary refrigerant.  Mechanical refrigeration is a thermodynamic process where the refrigerant, ammonia, is used as a heat exchanging fluid to maintain a desired temperature in an enclosed environment.  The refrigeration cycle consists of evaporation, compression, condensation and expansion.  Evaporation and condensation are designed to alter the quantity of energy associated with the refrigerant.  Compression and expansion are designed to change the availability of the associated energy.  The refrigeration cycle is a closed loop process.  The ammonia cycle utilizes fluid temperature, pressure and latent heat of vapori

zation for cooling.  The refrigeration system uses this phenomenon to remove heat from a desired space, and then to discard that heat through condensation, to an area where it is of no consequence.

The King & Prince Seafood Corporation facility has approximately 520 employees, including hourly and salary personnel that manufacture and prepare shipment of frozen seafood products via truck 24-hours per day, five to seven days a week.
The potential hazards that could lead to an accidental release of the ammonia include, but are not limited to, equipment failure, damage to piping, damage to equipment, human error, etc.
Although ammonia is a colorless, tasteless liquid, its dominant characteristic is its pungent, distinct odor.  Persons exposed to ammonia will not voluntarily stay in areas of even small concentrations, although these levels would not normally result in any health risks.  Risks from accidental exposure to ammonia in a vapor state are irritations to the eyes, nose and throat.  The extent of irritation depends on the exposure amount and length of time exposed.
Ammonia is classified non-flammable by the Department of Transportation.  Ammonia will burn, but only in a very narrow concentration range when accompanied with a constant ignition source. 
    The following administrative and engineering controls are in place at King & Prince.  These controls are designed to eliminate, or reduce the possibilities of an accidental release from the refrigeration system.

?Electronic ammonia detection installed in the storage freezers.  Alarm system activates a local audible alarm to alert plant personnel of the potential ammonia leak in the monitored area.
?High liquid level switches are configured to recirculators.  High level switches will shut down associated compressor operation during a high level condition.
?All compressors are configured with critical safety controls (high pressure, low pressure, nigh oil temp cut-outs, etc.) to shut down the respective compressor

in the event of an abnormal operating condition.
?Safety Relief Valves are configured to all pressure vessels, condensers and compressor oil separators to eliminate over pressurization conditions in those associated pieces of equipment.
?Periodic Maintenance Program is in place within the maintenance department to ensure the refrigeration system and its components are kept in optimum mechanical and operating status.  Daily rounds are made by plant personnel to verify proper equipment operation.

3.Five-year accident history.

The King and Prince Seafood facility has had zero accidental releases in the last five years.

4.Emergency Action Program

The purpose of the King and Prince Seafood Emergency Action Plan is to:

1.Minimize exposure to our employees and the surrounding community in the event of a hazardous material release or spill.

2.Assure the safe emergency evacuation of the plant in the instance that it is required.

3.Provide for prompt medical attention to any employee who becomes seriously injured or ill at work.

4.Facility management has developed an emergency Response Plan to ensure a fast and efficient response in the event of an    accidental release of Hazardous materials.

Our emergency Action Plan currently meets requirements as set forth in OSHA 29 CFR 1910.38, Employee Emergency and Fire Prevention Plans.
